meanings.definition: To coat or decorate with a glossy black lacquer.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys japanning her wooden furniture to give it a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: The artisan is japanning the antique vase to restore its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter accidentally ended up japanning his own hands while working on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter japanned the room with joy as she shared her funny stories.
meanings.sent5: The sun japanned the sand on the beach, making it glisten in the light.

meanings.definition: The process of applying a glossy black lacquer to an object.
meanings.sent1: The japanning of the cabinet took several hours to achieve the perfect shine.
meanings.sent2: He learned the art of japanning from his grandfather who was a master craftsman.
meanings.sent3: The children found joy in watching the japanning of their toys at the workshop.
meanings.sent4: The japanning on the car gave it a sleek and elegant look.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient artifacts with intricate japanning designs.
